methods.name: getMatchingData
methods.comment:
Returns a list of data that matches the given searchText.  A match typically 
 means a "startsWith" match.  A list is returned to allow for multiple matches.

params.name: searchText
params.comment: The text used to find matches.

return.comment: a list of items matching the given text.

methods.name: getIndexOfFirstMatchingEntry
methods.comment:
Returns the index in the given list of the first item that matches the given text.  For 
 data sets that do not allow duplicates, this is simply the index of the item that matches
 the text in the list.  For items that allow duplicates, the is the index of the first match.

params.name: text
params.comment: the text to match against the items in the list

return.comment: the index in the given list of the first item that matches the given text.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the renderer to be used to paint the contents of the list returned by 
 {@link #getMatchingData(String)}.
methods.name: getListRenderer
methods.comment:
Returns the renderer to be used to paint the contents of the list returned by 
 #getMatchingData(String).

methods.javadoc:
Returns a description for this item that gives that will be displayed along side of the
 {@link DropDownSelectionTextField}'s matching window.
methods.name: getDescription
methods.comment:
Returns a description for this item that gives that will be displayed along side of the
 DropDownSelectionTextField's matching window.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the text for the given item that will be entered into the 
 {@link DropDownSelectionTextField} when the user makes a selection.
methods.name: getDisplayText
methods.comment:
Returns the text for the given item that will be entered into the 
 DropDownSelectionTextField when the user makes a selection.

name: DropDownTextFieldDataModel
comment:
This interface represents all methods needed by the DropDownSelectionTextField in order
 to search, show, manipulate and select objects.
